channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-1597] RTF with embedded image parsing produces div before html
item.description:
On tika-1.8-rc1.

java -jar tika-app/target/tika-app-1.8.jar -x 2.rtf returns

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">HOHcvanAHTI'Imoc
v8 Hanemnan npﬁBOBaﬁ "DRAW

</div>
<html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<!-- tail omitted -->

Removing image prevents such behavior (3.rtf doesn't contain embedded image).

Update: you should have tesseract installed to reproduce this issue.
item.summary: RTF with embedded image parsing produces div before html

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This is bizarre. All works with the ToXMLContentHandler and the ToHTMLContentHandler...will look into it.

I can't reproduce this with:
java version "1.7.0_75"
OpenJDK Runtime Environment (rhel-2.5.4.0.el6_6-x86_64 u75-b13)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM (build 24.75-b04, mixed mode)

Tried both 1.8-rc1 and trunk.

java -jar tika-app-1.9-SNAPSHOT.jar -x 2.rtf
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta name="meta:author" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="Content-Length" content="68894"/>
<meta name="dc:creator" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="Author" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="X-Parsed-By" content="org.apache.tika.parser.DefaultParser"/>
<meta name="X-Parsed-By" content="org.apache.tika.parser.rtf.RTFParser"/>
<meta name="Content-Type" content="application/rtf"/>
<meta name="resourceName" content="2.rtf"/>
<meta name="creator" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="dc:title" content=""Воздушный кодекс Российской Федерации" от 19.03.1997 N 60-ФЗ(ред. от 02.07.2013)(с изм. и доп., вступающими в силу с 05.12.2013)"/>
<title>"Воздушный кодекс Российской Федерации" от 19.03.1997 N 60-ФЗ(ред. от 02.07.2013)(с изм. и доп., вступающими в силу с 05.12.2013)</title>
</head>
<body><p/>
...

Can't reproduce with Oracle 1.8.0_40 on rhel.
java version "1.8.0_40"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.8.0_40-b26)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 25.40-b25, mixed mode)

java -jar tika-app-1.8.jar -x 2.rtf
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta name="X-Parsed-By" content="org.apache.tika.parser.DefaultParser"/>
<meta name="X-Parsed-By" content="org.apache.tika.parser.rtf.RTFParser"/>
<meta name="creator" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="meta:author" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="dc:title" content=""Воздушный кодекс Российской Федерации" от 19.03.1997 N 60-ФЗ(ред. от 02.07.2013)(с изм. и доп., вступающими в силу с 05.12.2013)"/>
<meta name="dc:creator" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="Author" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="resourceName" content="2.rtf"/>
<meta name="Content-Length" content="68894"/>
<meta name="Content-Type" content="application/rtf"/>
<title>"Воздушный кодекс Российской Федерации" от 19.03.1997 N 60-ФЗ(ред. от 02.07.2013)(с изм. и доп., вступающими в силу с 05.12.2013)</title>
</head>
<body><p/>
...

I'll try to reproduce on other linux host. On my dev laptop it reproduces on openjdk7, oracle jdk7 and oracle jdk8.

Do you have headless jdk or not?

This returns true:

        public static void main(String[] args) {
                System.out.println(GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless());
        }

When I look closer, I'm not seeing any <div> markers in my output with -x, and I'm not seeing any text that should derive from the image file with -t. When I run -J, I do see that the embedded doc is extracted, and there is metadata for the image file.

For the record, "I can't reproduce" != "I don't believe you"

The problem may be caused by not sending in the wrapped XHTMLContentHandler into the RTFEmbObjHandler.

If you change the initialization of the embObjHandler and the textExtractor ert to:

            XHTMLContentHandler xHandler = new XHTMLContentHandler(handler, metadata);
            RTFEmbObjHandler embObjHandler = new RTFEmbObjHandler(xHandler,
                    metadata, context);
            final TextExtractor ert = 
                    new TextExtractor(xHandler, metadata, embObjHandler);

Does the problem go away?

I'm also unable to reproduce it on:

  • centos 6 (with oracle jdk7),
  • centos 7 (with openjdk8),
  • kubuntu 14.04.2 (with openjdk7).

With proposed change (for RTFParser) I have this div in body tag:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><html xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
<head>
<meta name="meta:author" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="Content-Length" content="68894"/>
<meta name="dc:creator" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="Author" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="X-Parsed-By" content="org.apache.tika.parser.DefaultParser"/>
<meta name="X-Parsed-By" content="org.apache.tika.parser.rtf.RTFParser"/>
<meta name="Content-Type" content="application/rtf"/>
<meta name="resourceName" content="2.rtf"/>
<meta name="creator" content="ConsultantPlus"/>
<meta name="dc:title" content=""Воздушный кодекс Российской Федерации" от 19.03.1997 N 60-ФЗ(ред. от 02.07.2013)(с изм. и доп., вступающими в силу с 05.12.2013)"/>
<title>"Воздушный кодекс Российской Федерации" от 19.03.1997 N 60-ФЗ(ред. от 02.07.2013)(с изм. и доп., вступающими в силу с 05.12.2013)</title>
</head>
<body><div>HOHcvanAHTI'Imoc
v8 Hanemnan npﬁBOBaﬁ "DRAW

</div>

<p/>
<p/>
<p>"Воздушный кодекс Российской Федерации" от 19.03.1997 N 60-ФЗ
(ред. от 02.07.2013)
(с изм. и доп., вступающими в силу с 05.12.2013)</p>
<p/>
<p>Документ предоставлен <b><a href="http://www.consultant.ru">КонсультантПлюс</a>

<a href="http://www.consultant.ru">www.consultant.ru</a>

</b>Дата сохранения: 09.01.2014</p>
<p/>
<p/>
<p/>
</body></html>

I think, we can close it as "Can't reproduce". If someone will find easy way to reproduce this issue – we always can reopen it. =)

Div with HOHcvanAHTI'Imoc and v8 Hanemnan npﬁBOBaﬁ "DRAW means "КонсультантПлюс" and "надежная правовая поддержка", it's text from embedded image parsed with o.a.tika.parser.ocr.TesseractOCRParser (which is configured to extract english text).

To reproduce you should install tesseract.

Also, I'll commit proposed fix now, since div with text from embedded image should not appear before body tag.

SUCCESS: Integrated in tika-trunk-jdk1.7 #616 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/tika-trunk-jdk1.7/616/)
Fix for TIKA-1597

Patch suggested by Tim Allison <tallison@apache.org> (grossws: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/tika/trunk/?view=rev&rev=1672704)

  • /tika/trunk/tika-parsers/src/main/java/org/apache/tika/parser/rtf/RTFParser.java

Ah, phew, I was still not seeing the div after the fix...That explains it. Thank you.

And, thank you for reporting and fixing this!
